synsets.definition: The practice of maintaining social dignity through appropriate interpersonal distance that preserves both parties' reputation and standing without creating intimacy or vulnerability
synsets.cultural_note: Central to Chinese social interaction; involves strategic emotional distance to protect social face while maintaining harmonious relations

synsets.definition: Maintaining group harmony through emotional self-regulation and appropriate relational boundaries that prevent disruption while preserving collective well-being
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese concept emphasizing social harmony over personal expression; cordial distance serves group cohesion

synsets.definition: Intuitive social sensing that maintains appropriate emotional and physical distance based on contextual awareness of others' needs and boundaries
synsets.cultural_note: Korean social skill involving reading situations to maintain optimal relational distance without offense or excessive intimacy

synsets.definition: Thoughtful restraint in relationships that avoids imposing on others through excessive familiarity or emotional demands while maintaining warm regard
synsets.cultural_note: Thai concept of considerate heart that naturally maintains cordial distance to avoid burdening others

synsets.definition: Elaborate system of polite social interaction that maintains respectful distance through ceremonial exchanges, preventing premature intimacy
synsets.cultural_note: Persian cultural practice creating structured social distance through ritualized politeness and formal exchanges

synsets.definition: The wisdom to distinguish appropriate levels of attachment and detachment in relationships, maintaining clear boundaries without coldness
synsets.cultural_note: Sanskrit philosophical concept of discernment applied to relationships, balancing connection with non-attachment

synsets.definition: Cultivated social behavior that maintains dignified distance in relationships through proper etiquette and measured emotional expression
synsets.cultural_note: Islamic concept of refined manners that naturally creates appropriate social distance while showing respect

synsets.definition: Self-restraint in social situations that maintains appropriate distance by not presuming intimacy or making excessive demands on others
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese social virtue of holding back to show respect and avoid imposing; creates natural cordial distance

synsets.definition: The balanced middle path in relationships that avoids extremes of attachment or detachment, maintaining steady moderate connection
synsets.cultural_note: Confucian ideal of moderation applied to relationships; avoiding excessive intimacy or coldness

synsets.definition: Proper limits and boundaries in social relationships that maintain respect and dignity while allowing appropriate connection
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu concept of proper conduct that establishes natural boundaries in relationships while maintaining social harmony

synsets.definition: Practical wisdom in managing relationships that knows when to maintain distance and when to allow closeness for optimal outcomes
synsets.cultural_note: Islamic concept of wisdom that includes knowing appropriate relational boundaries and timing

synsets.definition: Maintenance of social dignity through appropriate relational distance that preserves status while allowing professional or polite interaction
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept similar to face but focusing on maintaining dignified distance in social hierarchies

synsets.definition: Established forms of interaction that create appropriate relational distance through structured, predictable social patterns
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese concept of proper forms that naturally regulate social distance through prescribed interaction patterns

synsets.definition: Deep respect that maintains appropriate distance in relationships while acknowledging the other's worth and dignity
synsets.cultural_note: Turkish concept emphasizing respectful distance as a form of honoring others rather than coldness

synsets.definition: Proper ritual behavior that maintains social order through appropriate relational distance and formal respect
synsets.cultural_note: Confucian concept of ritual propriety that creates structured social distance while maintaining harmonious relations

synsets.definition: Balanced emotional stance toward others that maintains steady, non-attached goodwill without excessive involvement or indifference
synsets.cultural_note: Buddhist concept of equanimity in relationships that transcends emotional extremes while maintaining care

synsets.definition: Maintained dignity and composure in social interactions that creates natural appropriate distance through self-possessed behavior
synsets.cultural_note: Arabic concept of dignity that naturally regulates social distance through composed, self-controlled presence

synsets.definition: Maintaining relationships in a pleasant, easy manner that avoids both excessive seriousness and inappropriate intimacy
synsets.cultural_note: Thai cultural value of keeping interactions light and pleasant, creating natural cordial distance

synsets.definition: Polite formality that maintains appropriate social distance while expressing genuine respect and consideration
synsets.cultural_note: Korean blend of warmth and formality that creates comfortable social distance without coldness

synsets.definition: Delicate refinement in social interaction that maintains appropriate boundaries through subtle sensitivity to others' comfort
synsets.cultural_note: Persian concept of refined social sensitivity that naturally maintains cordial distance through subtle awareness

synsets.definition: Humble politeness that maintains respectful distance without servility, showing proper regard while preserving dignity
synsets.cultural_note: Sanskrit-derived concept of humble courtesy that creates natural appropriate distance through modest behavior

synsets.definition: Formal politeness that maintains social distance through ritualized courtesy while preserving harmonious relations
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese social practice of maintaining distance through polite formality, often used to preserve face and harmony

synsets.definition: Code of honor that maintains dignified distance in relationships through self-discipline and measured emotional expression
synsets.cultural_note: Samurai ethical code emphasizing controlled emotional distance as sign of strength and respect

synsets.definition: Refined character development that naturally maintains appropriate relational boundaries through ethical self-cultivation
synsets.cultural_note: Islamic concept of character refinement that includes knowing proper relational boundaries and maintaining them gracefully

synsets.definition: Sustained mindful awareness in relationships that maintains appropriate attention and care without attachment or aversion
synsets.cultural_note: Yogic concept of focused awareness applied to relationships, maintaining steady appropriate attention without emotional extremes
